meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the history and culture of different ethnic groups.
meanings.sent1: The ethnohistorical research shed light on the traditions of indigenous tribes.
meanings.sent2: Scholars use ethnohistorical methods to understand ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The ethnohistorical approach to history made the past come alive in a new way.
meanings.sent4: Her ethnohistorical analysis revealed fascinating insights into cultural evolution.
meanings.sent5: Through ethnohistorical investigations, we can uncover forgotten aspects of our heritage.

meanings.definition: Involving the combination of ethnology and history.
meanings.sent1: The ethnohistorical approach provided a unique perspective on cultural development.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts with ethnohistorical significance.
meanings.sent3: His ethnohistorical research project was both challenging and rewarding.
meanings.sent4: The ethnohistorical connection between past societies fascinated historians.
meanings.sent5: Ethnohistorical studies help us understand the interconnectedness of different cultures.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the historical development of a particular ethnic group.
meanings.sent1: The ethnohistorical analysis focused on the growth of a specific community.
meanings.sent2: Researchers explored the ethnohistorical roots of local traditions.
meanings.sent3: The ethnohistorical perspective added depth to the narrative of migration.
meanings.sent4: Ethnohistorical evidence supported the theory of cultural diffusion.
meanings.sent5: Studying ethnohistorical patterns helps us appreciate diversity within societies.
